fixes.name: Median Sales Price National
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted Tableau MEDIAN([Price]) to DAX MEDIAN('trulia_dataset_cleaned (trulia_dataset_cleanedTBL)'[Price]). The expression uses an aggregation, so it should be implemented as a measure.

fixes.name: Median Sales Price % Increase
fixes.dax_expression:
VAR medianPrice = MEDIAN('trulia_dataset_cleaned (trulia_dataset_cleanedTBL)'[Price])
VAR medianLastSold = MEDIAN('trulia_dataset_cleaned (trulia_dataset_cleanedTBL)'[Last Sold For])
RETURN (medianPrice - medianLastSold) / medianLastSold * 100
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted each MEDIAN(...) to DAX MEDIAN('trulia_dataset_cleaned (trulia_dataset_cleanedTBL)'[Column]). The calculation uses aggregations, so it is implemented as a measure.

fixes.name: County Drill Down
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated Tableau IF [State Set] THEN [COUNTYNAME] END to DAX IF('trulia_dataset_cleaned (trulia_dataset_cleanedTBL)'[State Set], 'trulia_dataset_cleaned (trulia_dataset_cleanedTBL)'[COUNTYNAME], BLANK()). This is row-level logic without aggregation, so it should be a calculated column.
